name: cfargument
description: Creates a parameter definition within a component definition. Defines a function argument. Used within a cffunction tag.

params.name: type
params.description: a type name; data type of the argument.

params.name: required
params.description: Whether the parameter is required to execute the component method.

params.name: default
params.description: If no argument is passed, specifies a default argument value.

params.name: displayname
params.description: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC.

params.name: hint
params.description: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value follows the displayname attribute value in the parameter description line. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter.

examples.title: Script Syntax
examples.description: For Script syntax the argument is inside the ()

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.description: For Tag syntax the argument is its own tag
examples.code:
<cffunction access="public" returntype="boolean" name="myFunction">
    <cfargument required="true" type="any" name="myArgument">
    <!--- Some function bits --->
    <cfreturn true>
</cffunction>
